question_text: Which characteristic of a high-quality crimp ensures long-term durability and proper contact in an RJ45 termination?
answer_options: A visible gap between wire ends and connector tip
The locking tab clicks loudly during connection
Firm metal-to-metal contact with insulation-piercing teeth
Connector tab bends slightly upward after crimping
correct_answer: Firm metal-to-metal contact with insulation-piercing teeth
explanation: Proper crimping drives the connectorâ€™s teeth through the wire insulation, creating solid metal-to-metal electrical contact for each pin.
